masked_text: Other candidates who have entered the 2024 Republican Party presidential primaries include former South Carolina governor and former U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Nikki Haley and current Florida governor [MASK0], who have since suspended their campaigns.
Pete Ricketts was appointed by Nebraska governor [MASK0] to fill the seat until the special election, which will take place concurrently with the regularly-scheduled 2024 Senate elections.
Laphonza Butler was appointed by California governor [MASK0] to fill the seat until the special election, which will take place concurrently with the regular election for a six-year term.
Texas's 18th congressional district: Democrat Sheila Jackson [MASK0] died on July 19, 2024.
Baltimore, Maryland: One-term incumbent Brandon [MASK0] was renominated for re-election.
In March, the Apache Tribe of Oklahoma reelected Durell [MASK0] III as tribal chairman and Matthew Tselee as vice-chairman.

The Ottawa Tribe of Oklahoma elected Mikal [MASK0]-Werner second chief, Kallista Keah as secretary-treasurer, Cody Hollenbeck first councilman, and Rachel Marie Yeakley to the tribe's grievance committee.
The Shoshone-Bannock Tribes in Idaho elected [MASK0] Juan Tyler as chair of the Fort Hall Business Council.
In July, the Chickasaw Nation reelected David Woerz, Toby Perkins, Nancy Elliott, Shana Tate Darter, and [MASK0] Wood to the tribe's legislature and Linda English Weeks to the tribe's supreme court.
